0.title: Man acquitted in Delhi riots case over officer's contradictory statement
0.article_body: A court on Tuesday acquitted a man in a February 2020 Northeast Delhi riots case. "The Investigating Officer (IO) contradicted his own statement regarding getting information prior to April 2, 2020, of the relevant witness," the court said. The identification of the accused on April 2, 2020, was probably an outcome of an afterthought development, it added.

1.title: Ford stock suffers worst day since 2011, sheds $7 billion in market value
1.article_body: Ford Motor's stock suffered its worst day in over 11 years after it said inflation-related costs would be $1 billion more than expected in the current quarter. While $7 billion was wiped off from its market value, the stock closed at $13.09 apiece on Tuesday, down by 12.3%. In January 2011, the stock had shed 13.4% to close at $16.27/share.

2.title: Huge protest breaks out at Punjab's Lovely Professional University over student's suicide
2.article_body: Students at Lovely Professional University (LPU) in Jalandhar held a massive protest on Tuesday night after a first-year student of Bachelor of Design allegedly died by suicide. Police said they recovered a note in which the 21-year-old student mentioned personal reasons for taking the extreme step. The university said it is providing full support to the authorities for further investigation.

3.title: Nikki Haley responds after US host calls her 'chameleon' for not using Indian name
3.article_body: Former US ambassador to UN Nikki Haley has responded after a US chat show host criticised her for not going by her first name. Sunny Hostin labeled Haley a "chameleon" for not embracing her ethnicity. Haley, whose first name is Nimrata, has gone by her middle name, Nikki, since childhood. Haley called Hostin "racist" for her "hypocrisy towards conservative minorities".

4.title: Don't want anything for myself, only interested in uniting Oppn: Nitish Kumar
4.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said he is only interested in uniting Opposition parties ahead of the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. His statement came as he dismissed speculations over his candidature in Lok Sabha polls from Uttar Pradesh. "I don't want anything for myself...whatever I am doing, it is for the younger generation...for people like Tejashwi Yadav," Kumar said.

5.title: Biggest threat to mainstream media is mainstream channels: Anurag Thakur
5.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur said that in his personal opinion, the "biggest threat" to mainstream media is not from the new-age digital platforms but rather the mainstream media channels. "If you decide to invite guests who are polarising, who spread false narratives, who shout at the top of their lungs, the credibility of your channels go down," Thakur added.

6.title: Labourer arrested for stealing ambulance from Hyd's Gandhi Hospital
6.article_body: The Hyderabad Police arrested a man, who worked as a labourer, for allegedly stealing an ambulance from Gandhi Hospital while the ambulance driver was occupied moving a patient to a ward. The accused K Yadagiri saw that the ambulance driver left the keys in the ambulance and later drove off with the vehicle, the police said.

7.title: Twitter to depose Elon Musk next week in $44 billion buyout case
7.article_body: Twitter will question Elon Musk under oath in Delaware next week as part of its lawsuit against the Tesla CEO over their $44 billion buyout deal. The deposition, scheduled to begin on September 26, could last up to three days. Twitter will also question Musk's aide Jared Birchall and lawyer Alex Spiro in the coming days, court filings showed.

8.title: 52-yr-old Pune auditor dies by suicide, 4 private moneylenders arrested
8.article_body: A 52-year-old auditor allegedly died by suicide in Pune following which four private moneylenders were arrested on the charge of abetment to suicide, police said. "We've recovered a suicide note...points to harassment by moneylenders from whom [the victim] had borrowed money," police added. The auditor, working for the State Cooperative Department, allegedly ended his life by hanging.

9.title: Gap to cut 500 corporate jobs in US & Asia amid declining sales
9.article_body: Clothing company Gap will cut 500 corporate jobs in San Francisco, New York and Asia as it looks to reduce expenses amid falling sales. Sales at the company, which also owns Banana Republic and Old Navy, are down roughly 10% from a year ago. Gap is eliminating positions that are open across several departments and has started notifying some employees.

10.title: Domestic help steals from Mumbai man to have luxurious life; arrested
10.article_body: A 20-year-old domestic help was arrested for allegedly stealing cash and valuables worth ₹3.23 lakh from her employer in Mumbai. She was hired six years ago by her employer, an elderly, to take care of his ill wife. According to police, she confessed to her crime, saying she wanted to marry her boyfriend and live a luxurious life.

11.title: Pune man booked for firing in the air during dispute over land
11.article_body: A man from Pune's Vimantal area was booked for firing one round in the air with his revolver during a dispute over land ownership, said police on Tuesday. The man was visiting the site where he had recently bought land when some persons came and allegedly attacked him, according to police. His revolver's licence had expired, added police.

12.title: Hero Vired offers accelerator prog. in Business Analytics & Data Science
12.article_body: Hero Vired has launched an accelerator program in Business Analytics & Data Science with placement assurance. The program is designed to help newcomers & those without a background in tech to kickstart their careers in data analytics and help them make data-driven business decisions, the company stated. It explores concepts & techniques of data analytics, predictive modelling & data visualization.

13.title: Wipro's slab on stormwater drain removed amid BBMP's demolition drive
13.article_body: A 2.4-metre concrete slab built on a stormwater drain within Wipro's campus in Bengaluru was completely removed on Tuesday as BBMP is carrying out an anti-encroachment drive in Mahadevapura zone. Last week, the civic authority released a list of high-profile encroachers which also included Wipro's name. However, the IT company said that the construction was done as per sanctioned plan.

14.title: David Warner shares Finch-Kohli's pic, apologises to fan after he says Rohit is captain
14.article_body: Australia opener David Warner took to Instagram to share a picture of Aaron Finch and Virat Kohli ahead of first India-Australia T20I and asked his followers about who'll win the match. An Indian fan reminded Warner that Rohit Sharma is India captain and not Kohli, suggesting him to change the picture. Warner apologised to the fan, saying, "I know sorry."

15.title: PM Modi was right when he said the time is not for war: French President Macron
15.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi was right when he said the time is not for war, French President Emmanuel Macron said at the United Nations General Assembly on Tuesday. PM Modi told Russian President Vladimir Putin, "Today's era is not of war...Today we will get the opportunity to talk about how we can progress on the path of peace."

16.title: 20-yr-old student jumps off college building in Delhi, dies; note found
16.article_body: A 20-year-old second-year BA student allegedly killed herself by jumping off the college building in Delhi's Kamla Market, police said. A suicide note was recovered from one of her pockets in which she did not blame anybody, police added. The student belonged to Haryana, DCP (central) Shweta Chauhan said. Inquest proceedings under CrPC Section 174 have been initiated, police stated.

17.title: Mumbai's Lalbaugcha Raja Mandal fined over ₹3 lakh for digging up road
17.article_body: The BMC has issued a notice to the Lalbaugcha Raja Ganeshotsav Mandal in Mumbai, asking organisers to pay a fine of ₹3.66 lakh for apparently digging up the road. An inspection carried out after the festivities found 53 holes on the footpath and 130 pits on the road. However, Lalbaugcha Raja Committee President has denied receiving any notice yet.

18.title: 4 killed as speeding truck runs over people sleeping on road divider in Delhi
18.article_body: As many as four persons died in Delhi as a speeding truck ran over people sleeping on a road divider. "An unknown speeding truck mowed down four people...injured two persons...while crossing DTC Depot Redlight in Seemapuri," police said. The accident took place at 1:51 am, following which two persons died on the spot and one was declared brought dead.

19.title: Every country should do what PM Modi did: US on what PM Modi told Putin over Ukraine war
19.article_body: After PM Narendra Modi told Russian President Vladimir Putin that this is not the time for war in Ukraine, US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan said, "We would like to see every country in the world making that case." "They can do it publicly if they like. They can do it privately if they like," he further said.

20.title: Virat Kohli's 'silent stare' pic from 1st T20I against Australia goes viral
20.article_body: Ex-India captain Virat Kohli's 'silent stare' picture from the first T20I against Australia has gone viral. Kohli's reaction came after Australia's Cameron Green slammed fours on the first two deliveries of their second over. "Every Indian fan's reaction," a fan commented. "I can see that Virat Kohli look becoming a meme," commentator Ian Bishop tweeted.

21.title: 35 firms applied for specialty steel under PLI scheme: Scindia
21.article_body: Union Steel Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said that as many as 35 firms had submitted 79 applications for specialty steel under the PLI (Production Linked Incentive) scheme. He added that the government planned to take specialty steel capacity to 28 million tonnes per annum (MTPA). A senior ministry official said the government would take around 35-40 days to shortlist applications.

22.title: SpiceJet sends 80 pilots on leave without pay for 3 months to cut costs
22.article_body: SpiceJet has asked 80 of its pilots to go on a three-month leave without pay as a temporary measure to rationalise costs. The pilots forced to go on leave without pay are from the airline's Boeing and Bombardier fleets. Meanwhile, a pilot said, "There's no assurance if those forced to go on leave will even be called back."

23.title: Bhagavad Gita not a religious book: Karnataka Education Minister
23.article_body: Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh said that the government will introduce the Bhagavad Gita in state-run schools from December. He added that the Gita was 'not a religious book' as it did not promote any religious practices as the Quran did. Nagesh further said that the Gita was a moral book and that it inspires students.

24.title: Hero MotoCorp partners with HPCL to install EV charging stations in India
24.article_body: Two-wheeler maker Hero MotoCorp has partnered with Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited (HPCL) to establish charging infrastructure for EVs in India. A statement by the companies said they would start by establishing charging infrastructure at HPCL's existing energy station network. Each charging station will feature multiple smart and fast DC and AC chargers for all two-wheeled EVs.

25.title: Decorum, discipline are heart and soul of democracy: VP Dhankhar
25.article_body: Vice President (VP) Jagdeep Dhankhar, while addressing Rajasthan Legislative Assembly members, said decorum and discipline are the heart and soul of democracy. He added that the reputations of elected representatives and the efficiency of parliamentary institutions were critical for democracy. Further, he also said that political parties needed to come together and resolve their differences.

26.title: Interpol unveils Delhi General Assembly logo featuring Konark wheel
26.article_body: The Interpol on Tuesday unveiled its logo for the 90th Interpol General Assembly, featuring the chariot wheel of Odisha's famous Konark Temple. Reacting to it, Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik said, "Filled with pride that Interpol has unveiled the logo...inspired by the intricately carved chariot wheels of Konark Temple." He further thanked the CBI for including the wheel in the design.

27.title: Paddy procurement in Punjab to begin from Oct 1: Bhagwant Mann
27.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann said that paddy procurement in the state will commence from October 1. "This time around 191 lakh metric tonnes of paddy is likely to come...Govt is committed to procuring every single grain of the crop," Mann said in a tweet. He also said that he reviewed the procurement arrangements.

28.title: Essar to invest $4 billion to set up steel plant in Saudi Arabia
28.article_body: Essar is planning to invest $4 billion to set up an integrated flat steelworks plant in Saudi Arabia, Amar Kapadia, a senior official at Essar, said. He added, "We have formally applied to the Saudi Industrial Development Fund (SIDF) [for evaluation]." The four-million tonnes per annum integrated plant will be completed by the end of 2025.

29.title: Former Kerala MLA & Congress leader K Mohammed passes away aged 76
29.article_body: Former Kerala MLA K Mohammed Ali passed away at a hospital in Kochi on Tuesday at the age of 76. The veteran Congress leader was under treatment for kidney-related ailments. Ali, who had entered mainstream politics through Congress' students' wing Kerala Students Union, won the Assembly polls consecutively from 1980-2006 and represented the Aluva constituency in the House six times.

30.title: Clarify stand on compensation for gas tragedy victims: SC to govt
30.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday asked the Centre whether it will go ahead with a curative petition which seeks additional compensation for the 1984 Bhopal gas tragedy victims. The petition seeks an additional ₹7,844 crore from the successor firms of US-based Union Carbide Corporation. The gas leak had killed over 3,000 people and affected over 1 lakh people.

31.title: India, France and UAE hold 1st trilateral ministerial meet
31.article_body: The first India-UAE-France trilateral ministerial meet was held in New York on Monday. After meeting UAE Foreign Minister Sheikh Abdullah bin Zayed Al Nahyan and French Minister Catherine Colonna, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said the meeting was an "active exchange of ideas between strategic partners". Jaishankar is presently in New York to attend a UN General Assembly session.

32.title: Delhi records 81 new COVID-19 cases, one fatality
32.article_body: Delhi on Tuesday reported 81 fresh cases of COVID-19 and one death due to the infection, according to data shared by the city health department. The national capital's active case count stood at 463, as per the daily COVID-19 bulletin. With the new cases logged on Tuesday, Delhi's total case tally climbed to 20,02,572.

33.title: Hijab is like pallu, even Indian Prez wears pallu: JDS K'taka Prez
33.article_body: JDS leader CM Ibrahim likened the hijab and the pallu over the head. Calling it an Indian tradition, he asked, "President of India takes pallu over her head, Indira Gandhi took pallu, is it PFI's doing?" The Karnataka government alleged before the Supreme Court that the hijab row was instigated by the Popular Front of India (PFI).

34.title: Very nice to hear: Ponting on Kohli acknowledging Anushka's support after scoring 71st ton
34.article_body: Reacting to Virat Kohli acknowledging Anushka Sharma's support after scoring his 71st international hundred, Ricky Ponting said, "He...spoke very fondly about his wife's influence on...last couple of years of his life...which is also very nice to hear." Ponting added, "A lot of that stuff goes unspoken about, in men's sport in particular."

35.title: Lioness kills 15-year-old boy in Gujarat's Amreli
35.article_body: A 15-year-old boy was killed in an attack by a lioness at Vavdi village in Gujarat's Amreli district on Tuesday. The deceased, Rahul Meswaniya, was attacked when he was passing through an isolated patch of a road on the outskirts of the village, an official said. Notably, cages were being set up to trap the lioness, the official added.

36.title: Best woman Agnipath Navy inductee to get General Bipin Rawat Award
36.article_body: The best woman inductee in the Navy under the Agnipath scheme would be given the General Bipin Rawat Award, Navy chief Admiral R Hari Kumar said on Tuesday. The scheme began taking shape when General Rawat was the Chief of Defence Staff, he added. The Admiral stated that he and others in the armed forces were fully behind the scheme.

37.title: US and Canadian naval vessels sail through the Taiwan Strait
37.article_body: A US Navy warship and a Canadian frigate sailed through the Taiwan Strait as part of a routine transit on Tuesday, the US military said. The transit was carried out through a corridor beyond the territorial waters of any country, it added. Notably, China has protested the passage of western naval vessels through the strait in recent years.

38.title: Survey of madrasas begins in Kanpur
38.article_body: The survey of madrasas has started in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur, Sub Divisional Magistrate Himanshu Nagpal said. "We are checking certain points such as land records, syllabus, cleanliness [and] housing facilities," he added. According to the state government's order, the survey will be on the basis of 12 aspects. The teams for the survey have been constituted by the District Magistrate.

39.title: Adam Levine issues statement after being accused of cheating, says 'I crossed the line'
39.article_body: 'Maroon 5' singer Adam Levine responded after Instagram model Sumner Stroh accused him of cheating on his wife Behati Prinsloo. "I used poor judgment in speaking with anyone other than my wife in any kind of flirtatious manner. I didn't have an affair, nevertheless, I crossed the line," he said. Sumner had shared alleged DMs sent to her by Levine.

40.title: Rohit jokingly grabs Karthik's head and jaw after review, pic goes viral
40.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma jokingly grabbed Dinesh Karthik's head and jaw after a successful review that resulted in Australia's Glenn Maxwell's wicket in the first T20I in Mohali. This came after Karthik made a half-hearted appeal after taking Maxwell's catch and Rohit appeared to tell him to appeal in such situations. The umpire had originally declared Maxwell not out.

41.title: Canadian PM criticised for singing at hotel 2 days before Queen's funeral, responds
41.article_body: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau faced backlash from some people over a video of him singing 'Bohemian Rhapsody' at a London hotel, two days before Queen Elizabeth II's funeral. Critics called Trudeau singing during Canada's 10-day period of mourning "inappropriate". Trudeau's office responded, "Over the past 10 days, the PM has taken part in various activities to pay...respects to the Queen."

42.title: Old Pension Scheme to be implemented if AAP wins Gujarat: Kejriwal
42.article_body: Arvind Kejriwal guaranteed government employees in Gujarat that if the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) wins elections in the state, then the Old Pension Scheme (OPS) would be implemented. Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann has issued an order considering the implementation of the scheme in the AAP-ruled state, Kejriwal added. He urged state government employees to dethrone BJP government in Gujarat.

43.title: Secure release of TN fishermen arrested by Sri Lankan Navy: CM to Centre
43.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Tuesday urged External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar to secure the release of fishermen arrested by the Sri Lankan Navy. The Sri Lankan Navy arrested eight fishermen belonging to Pudukkottai today and seized their mechanised boats, Stalin said in his letter. Over 95 fishing boats and 11 fishermen are still in their custody, he added.

44.title: 'Yuvraj Singh Stand', 'Harbhajan Singh Stand' inaugurated at Mohali stadium, pics surface
44.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann inaugurated the 'Yuvraj Singh Stand' and 'Harbhajan Singh Stand' at Punjab Cricket Association Stadium in Mohali on Tuesday. "It's a nice feeling to be back at PCA Stadium like this. I'm wearing...BCCI blazer at my own stadium for the first time. It feels wonderful to be called by my ex-parent association and get acknowledged," Yuvraj said.

45.title: Will vote for those who accept Nehru family: Kerala MP on Congress polls
45.article_body: Kerala Congress senior leader K Muraleedharan said that the state party would vote for only those who recognise the prominence of the Nehru family for the post of Congress chief. He also added that there was no dispute regarding Rahul Gandhi taking the post. Congress is likely to see a contest for the post of party chief after two decades.

46.title: Useless talk: Bihar CM on claims of him fighting LS polls from UP
46.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar termed reports of him contesting the 2024 Lok Sabha (LS) elections from UP as "bekaar baat" (useless talk). "My only interest is to unite as many parties as possible...That will be a big achievement," said Kumar. JD(U) President Lalan Singh had said that Kumar was offered three LS seats in UP to choose from for 2024.

47.title: Russian State Duma okays tougher punishment for deserting soldiers
47.article_body: The Russian State Duma on Tuesday approved a bill which seeks to toughen punishments for soldiers who surrender to the enemy or desert a military unit. According to the bill, deserting a military unit during martial law would attract up to 10 years in jail. Under the present law, desertion by a soldier will attract a sentence of five years.

48.title: Queen Elizabeth II entranced Federer at Wimbledon in 2010: Virginia Wade
48.article_body: Recalling how Queen Elizabeth II left Roger Federer "entranced" when they had lunch together at Wimbledon in 2010, ex-British tennis player Virginia Wade said, "We all had this really in-depth, diverse conversation...She knew all about Roger." She added, "Roger was on...Queen's right and I was on the left. Everybody had big eyes." Queen Elizabeth II died on September 8.

49.title: Real journalism is presenting truth, letting all present their views: Thakur
49.article_body: Union Minister for Information and Broadcasting Anurag Thakur said that the "biggest threat to mainstream media is not from new age digital platforms, but rather the mainstream media channel itself". "Real journalism is about...presenting the truth and letting all sides [on] the platform present their views," Thakur said. He also remarked on media channels inviting "polarising" guests.

50.title: Minor Dalit girl abducted, raped for 2 days in J'khand; probe on
50.article_body: A minor Dalit girl in Jharkhand's Garhwa was allegedly kidnapped on September 6 when she went out to urinate and was raped for two days. On the third day, the accused left the house after threatening the girl of killing her family if she revealed anything about the crime to anyone. The victim's family registered a case on September 18.

51.title: 3 killed during protests over Mahsa Amini's death: Iranian official
51.article_body: Three people have been killed in Iran's Kurdistan province during protests over the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini, the region's governor said on Tuesday. He claimed that the three were killed as part of "a plot by the enemy", Iran's semi-official Fars news agency reported. Mahsa Amini died last week after allegedly being assaulted by police over "improper hijab".

52.title: Floods kill over 300 people in Nigeria, over 1 lakh displaced
52.article_body: Floods have killed more than 300 people in Nigeria this year, officials have told the Associated Press. The Nigeria National Emergency Management Agency said the floods have affected about 5,00,000 people and displaced over 1,00,000 people in 27 of the country's 36 states. The floods have also injured over 500 people, it added.

53.title: Gujarat state health workers start protest, list 14 demands
53.article_body: Employees of the Gujarat state government's Tuberculosis Control Programme have started a protest and have released a list of 14 demands, which include salary hikes and permanent employment for contractual employees. Around 1,100 employees went on mass leave on Monday, announcing an indefinite strike. The protesting personnel include treatment supervisors, laboratory supervisors and accountants.

54.title: Russia banned by UEFA from Euro 2024 qualification draw
54.article_body: The Russian Football Union and UEFA have both said that the country will not take part in the draw for Euro 2024 qualification. The Russian national team and Russian clubs were banned from international competitions by UEFA following the invasion of Ukraine. Russia had filed an appeal in the Court of Arbitration for Sport but the appeal was rejected.

55.title: Convinced Kapil Dev to retire after world record: Ex-India selector
55.article_body: Former India selector Anshuman Gaekwad has revealed that the BCCI had to convince Kapil Dev to retire after the ex-India captain claimed he could play for two more years. Gaekwad said they "allowed" Dev to play the 1994 Sri Lanka series so that he could become the highest Test wicket-taker. The ex-selector added that Dev took the advice with grace.

56.title: German gas storage facilities over 90% full: AGSI
56.article_body: Germany's gas storage facilities are more than 90% full, said European energy data platform Aggregated Gas Storage Inventory (AGSI). The German government has recently focused on energy security, as Russian gas imports via the Nord pipeline have stopped amidst the Ukraine war. The German government plans to fill its storage capacity to 95% by November ahead of the winter months.

57.title: Air ambulance facility soon from AIIMS Rishikesh: Scindia
57.article_body: Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said that the air ambulance facility is soon going to be operational from AIIMS Rishikesh. "Request for proposal will be invited in the next couple of weeks for AIIMS Rishikesh so that helicopters are pushed into service to save precious time and lives," said Scindia at the 49th national convention of AIMA.

58.title: Sunil Chhetri, Gurpreet Sandhu highest-ranked India players on FIFA 23
58.article_body: EA Sports' FIFA 23 game has ranked captain Sunil Chhetri its highest rated Indian player with a score of 68. Goalkeeper Gurpreet Singh Sandhu is second with a rating of 64 as Amrinder Singh, Pritam Kotal and Arindam Bhattacharya make up the top five with a 63 rating. EA introduced Indian players and ISL teams in its FIFA 22 iteration.

59.title: Rajnath Singh meets Egyptian President El-Sisi in Cairo
59.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh met Egyptian President Abdel Fattah El-Sisi in Cairo as part of his three-day visit to the Arab country. "Privileged to call on the President...India and Egypt continue to work on enhancing mutual trust and confidence,” Rajnath tweeted. Later, Rajnath met Egypt's Defence Minister General Mohamed Zaki and discussed expanding cooperation in the defence sector.

60.title: All the sharks came on the show to get famous: Ashneer Grover on 'Shark Tank'
60.article_body: In a recent interview, Shark Tank India's Ashneer Grover said, "[All the sharks will make] tall claims about different reasons why they did the show. I'll tell you...all the sharks came on the show to get famous." He added all the sharks shouldn't hesitate in saying they came for fame, adding, "Why are you bringing...nation and entrepreneurship into it?"

61.title: Once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to be in same team as Roger, Rafael, Andy: Novak
61.article_body: Speaking about being in the same team as three of his biggest rivals, Rafael Nadal, Roger Federer and Andy Murray, at Laver Cup, Novak Djokovic stated it's probably a "once-in-a-lifetime" opportunity. "Great to be here, exciting, full of emotional moments on and off the court, particularly for Roger," he added. All four will play for Team Europe in London.

62.title: S Jaishankar meets Indonesian counterpart in New York
62.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar met Indonesian Foreign Minister Retno Marsudi in New York as they discussed Jakarta's term as G20 President and the situation in Myanmar. Jaishankar is presently in New York to attend a UN General Assembly session and on the sidelines, he is meeting foreign leaders. India will assume the G-20 Presidency in December this year.

63.title: RBI removes Central Bank of India from PCA list
63.article_body: RBI on Tuesday said that it has removed the Central Bank of India from the Prompt Corrective Action Framework list. The bank was no longer in breach of PCA parameters as per its 2021-22 results, RBI said. The bank committed that it'd comply with norms of minimum regulatory capital, net NPA and leverage ratio on an ongoing basis, it added.

64.title: Australia record their highest-ever successful chase against India in T20I cricket
64.article_body: Australia defeated India by four wickets in the first T20I in Mohali on Tuesday. Australia recorded their highest successful T20I run chase against India by chasing down a 209-run target. Australia's previous highest successful T20I chase against India had come on February 27, 2019, when they chased down a 191-run target.

65.title: Bride walks on road full of potholes for photoshoot in Kerala, pics go viral
65.article_body: A bride and a wedding photographer from Kerala have done a photoshoot on a road full of potholes to highlight the issue of potholes in the area. Shared by Arrow Wedding Company, a clip shows her dressed in traditional wedding attire and jewellery as she walks across a road with potholes. The clip has amassed more than 4 million views.

66.title: MP Sanjay Raut prima facie recipient of proceeds of crime: Court
66.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut prima facie appears to be the recipient of proceeds of crime to the tune of ₹1.06 crore, a special court said in its order. The court was taking cognisance of the supplementary chargesheet filed against Raut by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) last week. Raut was arrested by the ED on August 1.

67.title: Kashmir Files maker Vivek congratulates Chhello Show team for Oscars entry
67.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri took to Twitter on Tuesday to congratulate the team of 'Chhello Show' after it was announced that the Gujarati film would be India's contender for the 2023 Oscars. "Wishing them the best film award at the #Oscars2023," he wrote. "I thank all the well-wishers and [especially] media which was rooting for #TheKashmirFiles," Vivek added.

68.title: There's need to start 'Bharatiya' education system: Arvind Kejriwal
68.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal called for a "Bharatiya" or indigenous education system in place of the one inherited from the British. "Not just NCERT books but the entire content needs to be changed," said Kejriwal. He added that despite having the best engineers and doctors, "it is a matter of shame" that Indians go to Ukraine to study medicine.

69.title: Iranian Supreme Leader's aide visits family of Mahsa Amini
69.article_body: An aide to Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei paid a visit to the family of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini who died last week after allegedly being assaulted by police over "improper hijab", state media reported on Tuesday. Abdolreza Pourzahabi, Khamenei's representative in the Kurdistan province, also ensured Amini's family that their rights would not be ignored, media reports said.

70.title: Kashmir Files, RRR were nowhere in front of Chhello Show: FFI President
70.article_body: Film Federation of India (FFI) President producer TP Aggarwal has revealed that the Gujarati film 'Chhello Show (Last Film Show)' was "unanimously" chosen as India's official entry for Oscars 2023 by the jury. "'The Kashmir Files' and 'RRR' were nowhere in front of this...They said there was no second or third film," the FFI President added.

71.title: Actor Salman Khan to take pay cut for 'Bigg Boss 16': Report
71.article_body: Actor Salman Khan will reportedly be taking a pay cut for 'Bigg Boss 16'. This comes after Mid-Day reported that the upcoming season will have reduced sponsors as last year's 'Bigg Boss OTT' did not meet expected revenue targets. 'Bigg Boss OTT' was hosted by filmmaker Karan Johar and actress Divya Agarwal had won the show.

72.title: 'I'm TMC leader, I'll kill you,' reads letter sent to Sushil Modi
72.article_body: Former Bihar Deputy CM Sushil Modi has alleged that a letter was sent to his residence in Patna from Bengal last month. The purported letter, shared by the BJP MP online, read, "I am [a TMC leader]...Mamata Banerjee could be the next PM...You are the pet dog of [PM] Narendra Modi...I will kill you on or before [August 31, 2022]."

73.title: OYO to get 'green tag' for eco-friendly hotels on its platform: CEO
73.article_body: OYO India CEO Ankit Gupta said that the company is working on getting a 'green tag' for sustainable and eco-friendly hotels on its platform. The 'green tag' will be given to hotels that have features such as solar powered lighting and rainwater harvesting. Recently, OYO filed financial documents with SEBI and reported EBITDA profit of ₹10.6 crore for June quarter.

74.title: Kohli gets out to Zampa because of overconfidence: Virat's childhood coach
74.article_body: Former Indian skipper Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma has commented on the former's record of getting dismissed to Australian spinner Adam Zampa on seven occasions in white-ball cricket. "I feel Kohli has always been dismissed to Zampa because of his overconfidence...Sometimes Kohli has tried to plunder him (Zampa) for runs and has ended up losing his wicket," Sharma said.

75.title: Mizoram and Assam CMs to meet tomorrow to work out border dispute
75.article_body: Mizoram CM Zoramthanga and Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma will be meeting in Delhi on Wednesday to find a solution to the border dispute between the states. The CMs last met in November for talks. The dispute between the states turned violent in July 2021, leading to the death of six policemen and an Assamese civilian.

76.title: Fossil eggs suggest dinosaurs were in decline even before asteroid impact
76.article_body: A study of the fossilised eggs unearthed in China stated that dinosaurs were in decline even before the large asteroid hit the Earth 66 million years ago. Researchers assessed 1,000 eggs and eggshells and found that dinosaurs were not very diverse before their extinction. Global climate fluctuations and massive volcanic eruptions may have already led to their decline, researchers said.

77.title: 7 policemen conduct checks beyond their jurisdiction in MP; suspended
77.article_body: Seven police personnel at Moti Nagar police station in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar city have been suspended for allegedly conducting checks beyond their jurisdiction. The suspended policemen include the in-charge of the police station. "Prima facie, no seizure was reported by these police personnel," Sagar Superintendent of Police Tarun Nayak said.

78.title: Flemish church defies Vatican, allows blessing same-sex unions
78.article_body: Belgium's Flemish Roman Catholic Church on Tuesday issued a document effectively allowing the blessing of same-sex unions. Notably, the move is in direct defiance of the Vatican's doctrine that prohibits the blessing of such civil unions. The document published by the Flemish Church, however, stressed that same-sex unions are not "what the Church understands by a sacramental marriage".

79.title: I'm not a controversial filmmaker, I respect all communities: Ali Abbas
79.article_body: Filmmaker Ali Abbas Zafar has said he's not a controversial filmmaker. "None of the films before my last outing (Tandav) has been controversial," he added. "I've respect for all communities and cultures. The beauty of Indian culture is we co-exist with a lot of love and mutual respect and I want to portray that in my films," said Ali.

80.title: What a brilliant way to end innings: Raina on Hardik's 71* in 1st T20I vs Aus
80.article_body: Following India all-rounder Hardik Pandya's unbeaten 71 runs off 30 balls in the first T20I against Australia, Suresh Raina said, "What a brilliant way to end the innings Hardik, congratulations on your half-century." He added, "Fantastic performance boys, let's win this." It is Hardik's second half-century in T20Is. India put up a total of 208/6 in 20 overs.

81.title: Many lessons can be learnt from Ukraine war: Indian Navy chief
81.article_body: Indian Navy chief Admiral Hari Kumar said there are "many lessons" to be learnt from the war between Ukraine and Russia. "Full-scale war apart, there could be the use of cyber warfare and other disruptive technologies," said Admiral Kumar. He added that there are three reasons to start a war: fear, honour and interest but ending it was more difficult.

82.title: India has potential to meet food requirement of world: Union Minister
82.article_body: Union Agriculture Minister Narendra Singh Tomar said India has the potential to become "Aatma Nirbhar" in agriculture and meet the food requirement of the world. "I use this opportunity to invite...international community to join hands with us for the benefit of coming generations," Tomar said. The country's agri exports have crossed the milestone of ₹4 lakh crore, he added.

83.title: Who's Sumner Stroh, the model who accused Maroon 5's Adam of cheating on his wife?
83.article_body: Sumner Stroh, the model who accused Maroon 5's Adam Levine of cheating on his pregnant wife Behati Prinsloo, is an Instagram influencer from Austin, Texas. The 23-year-old is a University of Texas graduate with a degree in Marketing and Advertisement. Sumner, currently the marketing manager of a jewellery brand, has reportedly worked as a media manager at Bumble.

84.title: Rahul Gandhi knows problems of poor, should be Cong Prez: Hanumantha Rao
84.article_body: Congress leader V Hanumantha Rao said that he believes Rahul Gandhi would be the most suitable leader for the post of Congress President. "As Rahul Gandhi is touring across the country, he knows the problems of the poor. Rahul should be president of the Congress party," he said. "Rahul Gandhi's family gave their lives for the country," Rao added.

85.title: Push towards apostasy: Muslim groups on bhajan in J&K school
85.article_body: A group of religious organisations in Kashmir objected to the singing of a bhajan at a school in Kulgam calling it 'speeding' of the "integration of younger generation with the Hindutva idea of India". A representative Muslim body said the "enforcement" of singing Hindu hymns is a 'cause of great concern'. Another group called it a "deliberate plan" towards "apostasy".

86.title: Three IS terrorists planning bomb blasts arrested in Karnataka
86.article_body: Police in Karnataka's Shivamogga arrested three individuals for allegedly being members of and working to carry out Islamic State (IS) activities. "The gang members were in possession of explosives and planned to carry out blasts across the state," said the police. The police also reportedly claimed that the trio had undergone training to carry out blasts and other terrorist activities.

87.title: Ayushmann is back with what he does best: Bhumi on 'Doctor G'
87.article_body: Actress Bhumi Pednekar took to her Instagram Stories to share the trailer of Ayushmann Khurrana's upcoming movie 'Doctor G'. "This looks insane guys...AK (Ayushmann Khurrana) is back with what he does best...What a cast. Can't wait to watch it," she wrote. 'Doctor G', directed by Anubhuti Kashyap, also stars Rakul Preet Singh and Shefali Shah.

88.title: Actress Ekta Sharma takes up job at call centre after not getting work on TV for 2 years
88.article_body: Actress Ekta Sharma has taken up a job at a call centre after she didn't get work on TV for two years. "I'm doing a respectable job...I'm proud of it," Ekta, who's also fighting a court case for her daughter's custody, said. "My only motive was...I wanted to live a life of a warrior, not a victim," Ekta added.

89.title: Carlsen applauds, flashes thumbs up to 17-yr-old Praggnanandhaa after their draw
89.article_body: World number one chess player Magnus Carlsen applauded and flashed a thumbs up to 17-year-old Indian Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa after their match in the Julius Baer Generation tournament ended in a draw. "I didn't see it then. I just checked it [later]. It was a great fight, I think," Praggnanandhaa said about Carlsen's gesture and the match.

90.title: I'm definitely done, I know that: Federer rules out any sort of comeback
90.article_body: When asked if he too could "unretire" in the future as Serena Williams hinted, 20-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer said, "No, no. I'm definitely done. I know that." Twenty three-time Grand Slam champion Serena, who retired during US Open 2022, didn't rule out a future comeback. Federer announced last week that he'll retire after upcoming Laver Cup in London.

91.title: Opium traces from 14th century BC found in ancient grave in Israel
91.article_body: Traces of opium dating back to the 14th century BC were found in vessels possibly used in burial rituals in ancient graves in Israel. This marks one of the world's earliest evidences of use of opium. "During these ceremonies...participants attempted to raise...spirits of their dead relatives...to express a request, and would enter an ecstatic state by using opium," researchers said.

92.title: NASA to conduct cryogenic test for Artemis I to check hydrogen repair
92.article_body: NASA will perform a cryogenic demonstration test for Artemis I on September 21. Hydrogen leak between Space Launch System rocket and liquid hydrogen fuel feed line had delayed its launch earlier. The test will help in checking if the leak has been repaired properly. During the test, supercold liquid hydrogen and liquid oxygen will be loaded into the SLS rocket.

93.title: Ananya, Nushrratt approached for Ekta Kapoor's 'KTina': Report
93.article_body: Actresses Ananya Panday and Nushrratt Bharuccha have been approached for Ekta Kapoor's upcoming film titled 'KTina', according to a report. It will reportedly be directed by Raaj Shaandilyaa, the filmmaker who helmed 'Dream Girl'. "They (makers) will work on the shooting schedule and other logistics once the cast is locked," a source quoted by Pinkvilla said.

94.title: 'GOT' stunt coordinator to design action scenes for 'Bade...': Report
94.article_body: Hollywood stunt coordinator Paul Jennings will reportedly be designing the action sequence in Akshay Kumar and Tiger Shroff-starrer 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan'. Paul has worked in 'Batman Begins' and 'Game of Thrones'. "They are in the final stage of conversation with Paul and it should be formalised soon," a source close to the development stated.

95.title: RBI not interested in penalising fintechs, wants them to follow rules: Guv
95.article_body: RBI is not interested in penalising fintechs or stifling innovation but wants them to follow the rules of the game, Governor Shaktikanta Das said on Tuesday. "RBI will continue to be supportive of [digital lending] and will welcome it. We will, in fact, go two steps forward to discuss with you if you just take one step forward," Das added.

96.title: Isolation centre opened for cattle with lumpy skin disease in Udaipur
96.article_body: An isolation centre has been opened in Rajasthan's Udaipur for cattle suffering from lumpy skin disease. Animal Husbandry Department said the disease is spreading as healthy cattle are coming in contact with infected ones. Milk production in Rajasthan is estimated to have reduced by six to eight lakh litres per day due to the disease, said Rajasthan Cooperative Dairy Federation.

97.title: UP painter uses savings to make skeletal Brahmos missile designs
97.article_body: A painter from UP's Jaunpur has used his savings to make skeletal designs of the Brahmos missile and a helicopter. Painter Sarvesh says he wants "to make people aware of the sacrifice of defence personnel" and started the project two years ago. Sarvesh said he currently works as a labourer and tries to save money to put into pending work.

98.title: EPFO adds 18.23 lakh subscribers in July, posts 24% YoY rise
98.article_body: The Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) added 18.23 lakh net subscribers in July 2022, marking an increase of over 24% as compared to the year-ago period, Labour Ministry data showed. Of the total additions, around 10.58 lakh members joined EPFO's social security ambit for the first time. About 57.69% of the new subscribers are from the age-group of 18-25 years.

99.title: Hurts to see media pick up adverse global comments on India: Dhankhar
99.article_body: Vice-President (VP) Jagdeep Dhankhar said it "pains" his heart when the media picks up, in "high decibel", adverse comments made against India by someone disconnected from ground reality. "That kind of politics has to be contained," said Dhankhar. He added that India had never received so much global attention and the image of Indians abroad is a matter of pride.

100.title: Ambala court sentences man to 20 years in prison for raping minor
100.article_body: A man was handed a 20-year prison sentence by a fast track court in Haryana's Ambala on Tuesday for raping a 14-year-old girl. According to the prosecution, the convict came to the victim's house in April 2020 while her parents were away and gave her chocolate to eat, after which she fell asleep. The 24-year-old man then raped the minor.

101.title: Raj CM calls late-night meeting of Congress MLAs ahead of party's Prez polls
101.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has called a late-night meeting of Congress MLAs at 10 pm on Tuesday ahead of the party's Presidential polls. "Meeting's agenda isn't clear," a cabinet minister of Rajasthan government said. Gehlot, who is scheduled to travel to Kerala on Wednesday to join 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', is likely to file nomination for the polls between September 24-28.

102.title: Odisha college student beaten by brother for ignoring studies, dies
102.article_body: A 21-year-old college student in Odisha's Bhubaneswar was allegedly thrashed to death by his elder brother for neglecting his studies and leading a "lavish lifestyle", police said on Tuesday. The elder brother, who was reprimanding the student, picked up an iron pipe and beat him up when he didn't listen. The accused was arrested on Tuesday after police got information.

103.title: Film industry was praying for 'Brahmastra' to do well: Alia Bhatt
103.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has said that everyone in the film industry wanted her film 'Brahmastra' to do well at the box office. "I don't think I have ever gotten so many 'all the best' messages before a film...That spirit of the industry even before the release was very special to witness," she further added. The film also featured Ranbir Kapoor.

104.title: Argentina sees shortage of football WC stickers; fans call it 'frustrating'
104.article_body: The convenience stores in Argentina have reportedly run out of stocks of football World Cup stickers that have become quite popular among the citizens. According to Reuters, the craze has led to the creation of an app that allows fans to track the availability of stickers. "It's frustrating," a resident said as fresh stocks are getting sold out within hours.

105.title: Odisha woman falls off bike as saree gets entangled in wheel, dies
105.article_body: A woman fell off a moving motorbike after her saree got entangled in the rear wheel of the two-wheeler in Odisha on Tuesday. The woman, Geetanjali Rana, died due to severe head injuries. A man named Judhisthir Rana was driving the bike with his wife Santoshini and Geetanjali riding pillion when the accident happened. Judhisthir and Santoshini sustained critical injuries.

106.title: Fintech sector needs to work relentlessly on safety, reliability: PM
106.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said the fintech industry needs to work relentlessly on safety and reliability to uphold trust of the people. "Rapid, relentless and proactive work in ensuring security, safety and reliability is important to uphold the enormous trust that the people have placed," he said. PM Modi said this in his message at the Global Fintech Fest.

107.title: He frees his mind and strike rate is natural outcome: Harsha on Rahul's 55(35)
107.article_body: Commenting on India opener KL Rahul's strike rate of 157.14 during his 35-ball 55 in the first T20I against Australia in Mohali, commentator Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "So, you see, KL Rahul doesn't have to worry about, or think of, strike rates." He added, "He frees his mind and the strike rate is the natural outcome."

108.title: Didn't have a permanent house when I was growing up: Shefali Shah
108.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah revealed she did not have a permanent house while growing up as her father's job at RBI wasn't permanent yet. "There were times when he would request my uncle or someone to let me and my mom stay there," she stated. Shefali added she later lived in a 'kholi' in Mahim with her parents, uncle and aunt.

109.title: UPI aims to process 1 bn transactions a day in 5 years: Sitharaman
109.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said that Unified Payments Interface (UPI) has set a target to process one billion transactions a day in the next five years. She said the country is witnessing substantial growth in UPI transactions on monthly basis. Notably, about 6.28 billion UPI transactions worth over ₹10.62 lakh crore took place in July.

110.title: Violent protests in Bengal after child's body found in neighbour's house
110.article_body: People burnt a vehicle during a protest after the body of a missing child was reportedly recovered in his neighbour's house in West Bengal's Santiniketan. Police have detained the accused woman and appealed to villagers to maintain peace, the Birbhum Superintendent of Police said. The boy went missing on Sunday when he went to buy biscuits from a shop.

111.title: India record their highest-ever total against Australia in T20I cricket
111.article_body: India put up a total of 208/6 in their 20 overs against Australia in the first T20I today. It's India's highest total against Australia in T20I cricket. India's previous highest T20I total against Australia had come on October 10, 2013, when they registered 202/4. It's the third time India have aggregated a T20I total of 200 or more against Australia.

112.title: 25-yr-old Cong worker uploads pro-Pakistan post online, arrested
112.article_body: A 25-year-old Congress worker was arrested on Monday in the Laksar area of Haridwar for allegedly uploading a 'Pakistan Zindabad' poster on social media, police said on Tuesday. During questioning, the accused told the police that he had uploaded a poster and added the slogan by mistake, a police official said. A complaint was registered after the post went viral.

113.title: Ireland to increase state pension for those who work beyond 66
113.article_body: Ireland's cabinet has approved a reform in the country's pension scheme under which anyone choosing to work beyond the age of 66 will receive a higher state pension. From 2024, people will have the option to work until 70 years of age. For each year they work beyond 66, there will be an increment in their pension.

114.title: Belittled police: Ex-IPS officers to Prez on Kejriwal's Gujarat visit
114.article_body: Thirty former IPS officers have written a letter to President Droupadi Murmu, accusing Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal of "belittling" police officers during his recent visit to Gujarat. While campaigning for the coming elections in the state, Kejriwal had refused police protection while he was on his way to an autorickshaw driver's home for dinner.

115.title: Raveena Tandon to star in Arbaaz Khan's film 'Patna Shukla'
115.article_body: Actress Raveena Tandon has been roped in for a film titled 'Patna Shukla', which will be produced by Arbaaz Khan. Speaking about the film, Arbaaz said that the upcoming social drama has all the ingredients that the Indian audience wants to watch. He added that Raveena will be seen in a "never-seen-before avatar" in 'Patna Shukla'.

116.title: BJP, Cong united to abuse me: Kejriwal on 'Modi, Modi' chants in Guj
116.article_body: After being greeted with chants of 'Modi, Modi' at Gujarat's Vadodara Airport, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal said that BJP and Congress are united in their aim to "abuse him". This is the reason why BJP supporters never yell anti-Rahul Gandhi slogans when the Congress leader visits Gujarat, he added. "With elections approaching…protests against...AAP are going to increase," Kejriwal stated.

117.title: Video of anchor mistaking Rahul Gandhi for KL Rahul on live TV goes viral
117.article_body: A video of an anchor mistaking Congress' Rahul Gandhi for Team India batter KL Rahul on live TV has gone viral on social media. In the video, the anchor can be heard saying, "India captain Rohit Sharma has said that Rahul Gandhi would open in T20 World Cup." Reacting to the video, a user commented, "Please fact check."

118.title: Birthday wishes to bowler who is still a mystery for many batters: Irfan to Rashid
118.article_body: Irfan Pathan took to Twitter to wish Afghanistan spinner Rashid Khan on his 24th birthday and wrote, "Birthday wishes to the bowler who is still a mystery for many batters around the world. Rashid, have a good one brother." Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Enjoy your special day and have an amazing year ahead." Harbhajan Singh said, "Happy birthday Rashid, love always."

119.title: Power tariff revision won't affect the poor: TN CM Stalin
119.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Tuesday said the recent power tariff hike effected by the state government will not affect the poor. Electricity rates are still cheaper in Tamil Nadu compared to other states, Stalin said. He further blamed the previous AIADMK government's administrative negligence and debts of the state-run distribution company for the revision.

120.title: BharatPe could go public in 18-24 months: Chairman Rajnish Kumar
120.article_body: BharatPe Chairman Rajnish Kumar said the company could go public in the next 18-24 months. Speaking to CNBC-TV18, Kumar said that the company is working towards a few quarters of profitability for investor confidence in the company's plan. He added that the company's cash burn, which was $11 million per month, is down to a little above $2 million.

121.title: Uttara Kannada to get super-specialty hospital: K'taka Minister
121.article_body: Karnataka Minister of Health and Family Welfare K Sudhakar said CM Basavaraj Bommai has given approval for setting up a super-specialty hospital in Uttara Kannada district. "Location and other modalities regarding setting up the hospital will be discussed with the CM," he said. All aspects regarding healthcare infrastructure in the district were discussed with elected representatives, he added.

122.title: Uber asks India drivers to ensure rear seatbelts are functional
122.article_body: Uber asked drivers in India to ensure that rear seatbelts in their cars are functional. This comes amid a greater push for road safety, days after former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry died in a car crash. "To avoid any fines or complaints by riders, please ensure the seatbelts on the back seats are accessible and functional," Uber said.

123.title: Mother Dairy expecting 20% revenue growth in FY23 to ₹15,000 cr: MD
123.article_body: Leading milk supplier Mother Dairy's MD Manish Bandlish has said the company is expecting 20% revenue growth in FY23 to about ₹15,000 crore. "We are witnessing strong demand for all...milk and...dairy products," Bandlish said. Mother Dairy's turnover stood at ₹12,500 crore in last fiscal year. Notably, the company had increased milk prices by ₹2 per litre in Delhi-NCR in August.

124.title: After camera issue with 3rd party apps, iPhone 14 Pro users complain of 'slow' Camera app
124.article_body: After several iPhone 14 Pro users complained of camera issue while using third-party apps, several users have now complained of 'slow' Camera app. Users have suggested that the camera takes several seconds to load when the app is opened. The iOS 16.0.1 update does not appear to fix the issue for those who are impacted.

125.title: 'Cong co-owner Rahul 'glorifying hijab' through Bharat Jodo Yatra': BJP
125.article_body: BJP National General Secretary CT Ravi on Tuesday said that Congress "co-owner" Rahul Gandhi is "glorifying the hijab" through Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and accused the party of surviving on appeasement politics. 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is a "communal yatra", which is being done to save the "sinking fake Gandhis", Ravi further added.

126.title: Delhi-based developer Ajnara India goes into insolvency
126.article_body: Ajnara India has gone into insolvency after the National Company Law Tribunal on Tuesday admitted a petition filed by homebuyers. A total of 113 homebuyers filed the petition against Ajnara over default on construction of its project 'Ambrosia' and delay in possession of flats. According to UP-RERA's data, of all Ajnara projects, 99 complaints have been filed against Ambrosia alone.

127.title: Whether poor or rich, land encroachments won't be allowed: K'taka Minister
127.article_body: Karnataka Revenue Minister R Ashoka on Tuesday said that no matter what, encroachments will be vacated in Bengaluru by the ruling BJP to avoid flood situations in future. "Whether it is poor or rich, encroachments will not be allowed to stay," he said. "The parallel facility for the poor would be made after discussing with the CM," he added.

128.title: Was concerned about 'Ponniyin...' actors' weight during pandemic: Mani
128.article_body: 'Ponniyin Selvan 1' director Mani Ratnam revealed that he was concerned about the weight of actors associated with the film during the COVID-19 pandemic. "I kept texting the actors, keeping them in check. I would be like, 'Hi, Trisha Krishnan, how are you?'," he added. The film also features actors Vikram, Karthi and actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan.

129.title: Actor Armaan Kohli, arrested over drug charges, gets bail after 1 year
129.article_body: Actor Armaan Kohli has been granted bail by the Bombay High Court in a drugs case.  A single bench of Justice NW Sambre granted bail to Kohli on a surety of ₹1 lakh. He was arrested by NCB in August last year after a small quantity of cocaine was recovered from his residence in Mumbai during a raid.

130.title: Wouldn't change him for world: Alcaraz on replacing Ferrero with Federer as coach
130.article_body: On being asked if he would be interested in appointing Roger Federer as his coach if the 20-time Grand Slam offered his services, world number one Carlos Alcaraz said, "I couldn't [replace Juan Carlos Ferrero with Federer]." He added, "I've always said that Juan Carlos is my second father, I wouldn't change him for the world."

131.title: Dalit family fined ₹60,000 after K'taka boy touches idol in temple
131.article_body: A Dalit family in Karnataka's Koppal has been imposed a ₹60,000-fine after a boy from the family entered a temple, touched the God's idol and attempted to carry it on his head. According to local residents, the incident took place when the villagers decided to celebrate the temple's construction. Miscreants are also reportedly making threat calls to the boy's mother.

132.title: Barcelona forecast $274 million profit this season
132.article_body: Barcelona have recorded a profit of $98.27 million for the 2021-22 financial year and forecast a $274 million profit for the current season, the Spanish club said. The club's board of directors closed the financial year with a turnover of $1.017 billion. Notably, Barcelona rank second on Forbes' list of football team valuations at $5 billion, behind rivals Real Madrid.

133.title: Lawyer moves Kerala HC against 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' over traffic woes
133.article_body: A lawyer has filed a petition in Kerala High Court against Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' over disruption of traffic during the march. K Vijayan wants the court to permit the yatra to occupy only one half of the road. "Rahul Gandhi and [others]...are occupying entire breadth of...road," the petition stated. Vijayan claimed the yatra violates the Kerala Public Ways Act.

134.title: Woman kills 3-yr-old daughter, dumps body in garbage pile in Maha
134.article_body: A 37-year-old woman allegedly killed her three-year-old daughter, packed her body in a plastic bag and dumped it in a pile of garbage in Maharashtra's Palghar district, police said on Tuesday. The accused later pretended that her daughter had gotten lost, an officer said. Her relatives beat her up when they found the child's body, the officer added.

135.title: 'I'm like your uncle,' texted delivery man after kissing 19-year-old at Pune home
135.article_body: A food delivery agent in Pune forcibly kissed a 19-year-old after finding her alone at home, police said. "The man...asked for water and got inside the house. When she returned, he grabbed her by the arm and kissed her twice," added police. He left as she resisted and later sent her messages saying he was "like her uncle".

136.title: I'm Hrithik's fan, would be a dream come true to meet him: Anil's lookalike
136.article_body: American bodybuilder John Effer aka Giovanni DelBiondo, who went viral for having a resemblance to actor Anil Kapoor, has said he's a huge fan of actor Hrithik Roshan. "It would be a dream come true for me to meet Hrithik! He is amazing," he added. John further said he has seen every movie of Hrithik and Shah Rukh Khan.

137.title: We did remixes way too much, went overboard with it: Amit Trivedi
137.article_body: Music composer Amit Trivedi has said that remixes are almost dead in 2022. "Whatever works, we follow it to the extent that it becomes perishable...That's what happened here (with remixes)," he added. Amit further stated that composers did remixes way too much and went overboard with it. "Now the audience is also fed up [with] it," he added.

138.title: BJP wants to dismantle our religious & Sufi traditions: Mufti
138.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti on Tuesday accused the BJP government of dismantling all religious and Sufi traditions of Kashmir to implement its divisive agenda. "Hypocrisy has no limits since BJP themselves leave no opportunity to get a turban tying ceremony done whether at a mandir, dargah, or gurdwara," she said.

139.title: German data retention law violates EU law, bloc's top court rules
139.article_body: EU's top court on Tuesday ruled that Germany's general data retention law violates the bloc's legislation. The law mandates telecom operators and internet service providers to store users' communication and location data for a specified time period. It may only be applied in circumstances involving a serious threat to national security, the Court of Justice of the European Union(CJEU) said.

140.title: There are around 2.5 million ants for every human on Earth, says new study
140.article_body: There are around 20 quadrillion (20 followed by 15 zeroes) ants living on Earth, a new study has said. This means that ants far outnumber humans, with around 2.5 million ants crawling about for every human living today. The combined biomass of all ants on Earth amounts to 12 megatons of carbon, scientists said.

141.title: Rohit Sharma equals world record for smashing most sixes in T20I cricket
141.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma has equalled the world record for smashing the most number of sixes in T20I cricket. With his only six in the first T20I against Australia on Tuesday, Rohit took his tally of sixes in T20I cricket to 172. He equalled the tally of New Zealand's Martin Guptill, who has hit 172 sixes in 117 T20I innings.

142.title: Buckingham Palace shares pic of Royal Family taken 75 years ago to honour Queen
142.article_body: The Buckingham Palace shared a photograph of Royal Family taken 75 years ago, to honour Queen Elizabeth II. The late monarch is pictured with her husband, Prince Philip, at her shoulder, her sister Princess Margaret, Queen Elizabeth the Queen Mother, and her father King George VI. The Queen was laid to rest at St George’s Chapel in Windsor on Monday.

143.title: Marriage not merely for sexual pleasure, its main purpose is to progenate: HC
143.article_body: The Madras High Court observed that couples who tie the marital knot must understand that marriage isn't for mere carnal pleasure, but its main purpose is to progenate. The child born out of wedlock is the connecting link between two individuals, it added. The court was hearing an application filed by a woman seeking interim custody of her two sons.

144.title: Maharashtra govt clears 181 plots for industrial projects
144.article_body: The Maharashtra government has cleared 181 plots for industrial projects in the state. The decision came after the Industry Department reviewed 191 plots, which were cleared by the previous Maha Vikas Aghadi government after June 1 this year. The present state government has been criticised after Vedanta-Foxconn chose Gujarat over Maharashtra to set up a multi-billion dollar semiconductor plant.

145.title: PCC resolutions seeking Rahul as party head not binding: Jairam Ramesh
145.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said resolutions passed by Pradesh Congress Committees (PCCs) seeking Rahul Gandhi as the party's President have "no binding effect". "Nobody asked anyone to pass any resolution...Congress party workers are enthusiastic...They've been watching Gandhi walking for past 13 days. They know the pain he is undergoing," Ramesh said. "They all can relate to him," he added.

146.title: Politics of polarisation is eroding foundation for economic well-being: Basu
146.article_body: Former Chief Economist of the World Bank Kaushik Basu said that "the politics of polarisation and division is eroding" India's foundation for economic well-being. "Over 2020-22, India's annual GDP growth is 0.43%. This places India in the middle of the world's growth table. What's worrying is that a decade ago India was in the top three," Basu said.

147.title: 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' should have started from Guj or any BJP-ruled state: Kishor
147.article_body: Poll strategist Prashant Kishor on Tuesday said that Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' should have started from Gujarat where elections are due later this year or any other BJP-ruled state. Speaking after meeting activists supporting the cause of the separate Vidarbha state in Nagpur, he said, "If people have hope, then the idea of separate Vidarbha state can be pursued."

148.title: Valery Polyakov, cosmonaut who took longest single trip to space, dies at 80
148.article_body: Valery Polyakov, the Soviet cosmonaut who set the record for the longest single space stay by spending 437 days in space, died aged 80, space agency Roscosmos announced on Monday. His historic stay in space began on January 8, 1994, and continued until March 22, 1995. During this period, he orbited the Earth more than 7,000 times.

149.title: Muslim couple donates ₹1.02 crore to Andhra's Tirumala temple
149.article_body: Businessman Abdul Ghani and his wife Subeena Banu have donated ₹1.02 crore to Andhra Pradesh's Tirumala Tirupathi Devasthanam (TTD). Of the total donation, ₹15 lakh is meant for Sri Venkateswara Annaprasadam Trust, which provides free food to thousands of devotees daily. Remaining ₹87 lakh is meant for procuring furniture and articles in the kitchen of a temple guest house.

150.title: Punjab starts conjugal visits for prisoners with good behaviour
150.article_body: Punjab Prisons Department on Tuesday began conjugal visits for prisoners exhibiting good conduct. The prisoners will be able to meet their spouses for two hours once in three months and a separate room has been designated for these visits. At present, this will be allowed at Goindwal Sahib central jail, new district jail in Nabha and women's jail in Bathinda.

151.title: Drug smuggler's property on illegally-occupied land bulldozed in Ambala
151.article_body: The property of a man accused of smuggling drugs was bulldozed in Haryana's Ambala on Tuesday. Police said Praveen Kumar had occupied government land illegally.  "The construction…is being demolished by us with co-operation from city council following all legal procedures," they added. As per reports, there are many cases filed against him under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act.

152.title: Harassed by father out on parole, 2 sisters consume poison in UP
152.article_body: Fed up with being harassed by their father, who was out on parole, two sisters allegedly consumed poison in UP's Banda, resulting in the death of one, police said on Tuesday. The mother of the girls alleged that the accused and her brothers-in-law used to beat her and her daughters and didn't let them cook food in the house.

153.title: Japan's Kirin in talks to triple investment in Bira: Report
153.article_body: Japanese beverage company Kirin is looking to triple its investment in craft beer maker Bira, according to a report. Last year, Kirin invested $30 million for under 10% stake in the company and is looking to invest funds at an equity valuation of $450 million, Reuters reported. Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group is also looking to invest $15 million in Bira.

154.title: Starlink to seek exemption from sanctions in Iran: Elon Musk
154.article_body: Elon Musk said that SpaceX will seek for an exemption from sanctions to provide Starlink satellite internet to Iran. Musk's statement came in a response to a tweet from a science journalist saying Starlink's services could be a "real game changer for the future" of Iran. Currently, Iran is seeing protests over a woman's death in police custody.

155.title: Woman bitten by snake carried on cot across water in Chhattisgarh
155.article_body: A tribal woman bitten by a snake was carried on a cot across waist-deep water in Chhattisgarh as health officials couldn't reach her village due to heavy rainfall, officials said. At least eight villagers carried her on their shoulders across the nullah in Mungeli district. She was accompanied by another woman on the cot.

156.title: Sonam Kapoor and Anand Ahuja share 1st pic with newborn son, name him Vayu
156.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor and her husband businessman Anand Ahuja took to social media to share the first picture with their newborn son. Revealing that they have named him Vayu Kapoor Ahuja, the couple wrote, "In Hindu scriptures Vayu is one of the paanch tatvas." "He is the incredibly powerful lord of wind," the caption read.

157.title: The sun will rise again: Bishnoi after not being selected in India's T20 WC main squad
157.article_body: India's 22-year-old leg-spinner Ravi Bishnoi took to Instagram Stories to post his apparent reaction to not being selected in India's T20 World Cup 2022 main squad. He wrote, "The sun will rise again and we we will try again." Bishnoi has played 10 T20Is for India so far and has taken 16 wickets.

158.title: Alert level raised for volcano that caused largest eruption on Earth in 5,000 years
158.article_body: The alert level for a volcano below New Zealand's biggest lake was raised from zero to one on Tuesday after almost 700 small earthquakes were detected below it. The Taupo volcano caused the largest eruption on Earth in the past 5,000 years when it exploded 1,800 years ago. This is the first time that its alert level has been raised.

159.title: United Arab Emirates to launch its first lunar rover in November
159.article_body: The United Arab Emirates will launch its first lunar rover in November, the mission manager Hamad Al Marzooqi said. Named 'Rashid' after Dubai's ruler, the rover would be launched from the Kennedy Space Center in Florida aboard a Falcon 9 SpaceX rocket. "We've finished with the testing of the rover, and we are happy with the results," Marzooqi said.

160.title: Video shows 2 groups attacking each other with rods over drainage water in Pune
160.article_body: A video showing residents living in two buildings attacking each other with rods and wooden sticks has gone viral on social media. A fight allegedly broke out between the two groups over trivial issues like the release of drainage water in the parking lot and walking on the premises. The incident reportedly took place in Pune's Kirkatwadi on Tuesday.

161.title: Ensure victory to justice, not just clients: TN CM to law students
161.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Tuesday urged law students to ensure victory to justice and not confine to the success of their clients. Speaking at the silver jubilee of Dr Ambedkar Law University in Chennai, he said, "You should serve as messengers of justice. Utilise [your] legal acumen and debating skills to provide justice to the poor and downtrodden."

162.title: Gujarati film Chhello Show beats 'The Kashmir...', 'RRR'; selected as India's Oscar entry
162.article_body: Gujarati film 'Chhello Show' has been chosen as India's submission to the Best International Feature Film category at the 95th Academy Awards. 'Chhello Show', which is titled 'Last Film Show' in English, has been directed by Pan Nalin. 'The Kashmir Files' and 'RRR' were reportedly some of the movies under consideration.

163.title: India announce their playing XI for 1st T20I against Australia
163.article_body: Australia captain Aaron Finch won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in the first T20I in Mohali. India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah and wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant do not feature in the playing XI. Meanwhile, Axar Patel and Yuzvendra Chahal are India's two spinners for the match. Further, Umesh Yadav is playing a T20I after three years.

164.title: 1,032 hectares of ganja cultivation destroyed in a major operation in Himachal
164.article_body: The officers of the Central Bureau of Narcotics have destroyed 1,032 hectares of illicit cannabis (ganja) cultivation in Himachal Pradesh in one of the biggest destruction operations. During the operation conducted over two weeks, officers climbed daily up to 11,000 feet above sea level and even camped in sensitive areas. Drones were used for the detection and surveillance of cannabis.

165.title: When I do a Hindi film, I hope it's memorable for people: Dulquer
165.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan has said that he has grown up watching Hindi cinema, however, Dulquer added that he wants to do unique films in Hindi. "I come a little sporadically...there's always a gap. Whenever I do a film in Hindi, I hope it is memorable for the audience," he added. Dulquer made his Bollywood debut with the 2018 film 'Karwaan'.

166.title: Lies: Kejriwal on Mann being deplaned in Germany for being drunk
166.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday defended Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann amid allegations that he was deplaned in Germany for being "drunk". "The Opposition is slinging mud at Mann and spreading lies, as they cannot find a fault in his work," Kejriwal said. Will look into the allegations, said Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia.

167.title: 18-yr-old girl dies after being run over by train in UP
167.article_body: An 18-year-old girl died after she was run over by a goods train at Bharwari Railway Station in Kaushambi, UP. The incident took place when the deceased, Rinki, was crossing the railway line, an official said. Notably, Rinki's father, Ramvishal, works in the engineering department of the Bharwari Railway Station. The goods train was going towards Kanpur, the official added.

168.title: Akram told Arshdeep 'Sardarji, you are bowling very well': Jaswant Rai
168.article_body: Revealing Arshdeep Singh and his idol Wasim Akram's conversation during recently concluded Asia Cup, India pacer's childhood coach Jaswant Rai said, "Arshdeep told me that he met Akram bhai who told him, 'Sardarji, you are bowling very well. You are a good bowler'." Rai added that Akram told Arshdeep, "If you think you are perfect, then don't come to me."

169.title: 105 ATM burglaries reported since October 2018: Delhi Police
169.article_body: Delhi Police has recorded 105 cases of ATM burglary from October 2018 to August 31 this year. Of these, 52 cases have not yet been solved. Senior officials said robbers are now increasingly finding it easier to target unmanned ATMs in remote areas compared to bank robberies. The last bank robbery in Delhi was in October 2018.

170.title: Raj govt paid unemployment allowance to 6.04 lakh youths since 2019: Minister
170.article_body: The Rajasthan government has provided unemployment allowance to about 6.04 lakh youths under the 'Mukhyamantri Yuva Sambal Yojana' since February 2019, Minister of State for Skill Development and Entrepreneurship Ashok Chandna said. Only 29,000 applications are pending, he added. Speaking in Assembly, Chandna said that more than 1.57 lakh unemployed youths were getting the allowance at present.

171.title: Coming week, it'll be surreal being student again: Twinkle on master's degree
171.article_body: Author Twinkle Khanna is all set to start a master's course at University of London. She took to Instagram on Tuesday and wrote, "It took almost two years to plan all...logistics but I'm finally going back to university to do my Master's in Life and Creative writing." "It'll be surreal, this coming week, being...student again, scribbling down notes," Twinkle added.

172.title: Kherson to hold vote on joining Russia: Moscow-installed official
172.article_body: The Russian-installed administration of Ukraine's Kherson region on Tuesday said it has decided to hold a referendum on the region's accession to Russia. We have urged Kremlin to approve the vote at the earliest, the region's Moscow-appointed head Vladimir Saldo informed. Saldo added that he hoped Kherson would become "a part of Russia, a fully-fledged subject of a united country".

173.title: Hyderabad Income Tax Principal Commissioner transferred to Mumbai
173.article_body: Vasundhara Sinha, the Principal Commissioner of Income Tax, Hyderabad, has been transferred to Mumbai. This comes amid Income Tax raids across Telangana in connection with the alleged Delhi liquor policy scam. Sinha is a 1988 batch Indian Revenue Service (IRS) officer. She is the wife of Anjani Kumar, the Director General of the Anti-Corruption Bureau.

174.title: SRK danced in 'Happy New Year' rehearsals with dislocated shoulder: Choreographer
174.article_body: Choreographer Vrushali Chavan revealed Shah Rukh Khan had a dislocated shoulder and an injured knee during the rehearsals of his 2014 film 'Happy New Year'. She said Shah Rukh was walking with the help of a crutch. "When I was teaching him, he would dance like there is no tomorrow...this was during the rehearsals, not even the shoot," Vrushali added.

175.title: Old bridge at Pune's Chandni Chowk likely to be demolished on Sept 25
175.article_body: The old bridge at Chandni Chowk in Pune is likely to be demolished on September 25 (Sunday). Since it's the weekend, there will be less traffic on the Katraj to Dehu road bypass highway and other connecting roads to the chowk. At present, the pre-demolition work is underway and it will be completed by Friday.
