However, she decided to file an FIR after she caught him sexually assaulting her eldest daughter again.

349.title: Bhagavad Gita to be introduced in K'taka schools soon: BC Nagesh
349.article_body: Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh on Monday announced that the state government is contemplating the introduction of Bhagavad Gita in schools and colleges from this academic year. He added that the text will be taught as part of the moral education syllabus. "The discussion is ongoing. A committee will be formed and we'll take a decision soon," he further said.

350.title: Crompton Greaves approves 6% stake sale in Butterfly Gandhimathi
350.article_body: Crompton Greaves Consumer Electricals approved the sale of around 10.72 lakh equity shares at face value of ₹10 apiece of its material subsidiary Butterfly Gandhimathi Appliances. This sale represents up to 6% of its total issued and paid-up equity share capital and will be via an offer for sale. Butterfly Gandhimathi's shares closed at ₹1,506.20 apiece on BSE on Monday.

351.title: All is not well with our world: Priyanka Chopra at UN General Assembly
351.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra addressed the United Nations General Assembly on Monday, saying, "As we all know, all is not well with our world." She spoke about the effects of COVID-19, climate crisis and the UN Sustainable Development Goals. Priyanka also shared videos and photos from the event including a picture with Malala Yousafzai, Amanda Gorman, Somaya Faruqi and Judith Hill.

352.title: J&K Congress passes resolution to appoint Rahul Gandhi as party President
352.article_body: Ahead of the Congress Presidential election, the Jammu and Kashmir unit of the party passed a resolution to appoint Rahul Gandhi as Congress chief again. Various state units including Rajasthan, Chhattisgarh, Bihar and Tamil Nadu have already passed the resolution backing the Wayanad MP. The election for the Congress President is set to be held on October 17.

353.title: Majority verdict by larger bench will prevail: Supreme Court
353.article_body: The Supreme Court has ruled that a majority verdict by a larger bench will prevail over a unanimous decision by a bench of lesser strength. Although the number of judges constituting the majority on the larger bench may be less than or equal to the number of judges on the smaller bench.

354.title: 5 killed in Iran during protests over woman's death in custody: Rights group
354.article_body: At least five people were killed in Iran on Monday after security forces opened fire during protests over the death of a 22-year-old woman in police custody, a Kurdish rights group said. Mahsa Amini fell into a coma last week, hours after morality police held her for allegedly breaking hijab rules. Reportedly, a number of protesters had been arrested .

355.title: You've to be glam with Karan, or he won't call you on 'Koffee With Karan': Gauri
355.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's wife Gauri Khan, who will feature in the upcoming episode of 'Koffee With Karan', stated that she was looking forward to getting ready. "You have to be glam when you are with Karan (Johar), otherwise he won't take you on his show," she added. Gauri further said Karan has never asked her to appear on the show.

356.title: Alleged gas leak causes fire during cremation in Punjab; 22 hurt
356.article_body: At least 22 people suffered burn injuries after an alleged gas leak during a man's cremation at an electric crematorium caused a fire to spread in Punjab's Moga on Monday. A former village sarpanch said that the man's family and some villagers were standing near the crematorium. Of those injured, three people were admitted to civil hospital, a doctor said.

357.title: Should've apologised immediately: Faisal on Aamir's intolerance remark
357.article_body: Talking about Aamir Khan's statement on intolerance in 2015, his brother Faisal Khan said, "He should have apologised immediately after that thing came out, not when...'Laal Singh Chaddha' was releasing." "That seems opportunistic," added Faisal. "There is no harm in...correcting yourself," he stated. Discussing 'Laal Singh Chaddha', Faisal said, "Aamir should have selected a better script."

358.title: Custodial torture: Owaisi after beards of Muslim inmates shaved in MP
358.article_body: Five Muslim prisoners in Madhya Pradesh's Rajgarh jail have alleged that the jail authorities forcibly shaved their beards off. According to a prisoner, the jailer asked him, "Are you from Pakistan?" before shaving his beard. AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi called the incident "custodial torture and a violation of Article 25". The jailer, NS Rana, has denied the allegations.

359.title: 3 arrested for smuggling drugs via social media in Greater Noida
359.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar Police arrested three people for allegedly smuggling drugs and supplying them to college students across the country, including in Noida and Greater Noida. The accused reportedly did business through social media and traded in cryptocurrency to evade identification. They were arrested after the DCP posed as a buyer and lured them into coming to Greater Noida.

360.title: Child abduction messages on social media fake: Mumbai Police
360.article_body: The Mumbai Police said that news circulating on social media of children getting kidnapped from places like Vikhroli and Ghatkopar are all fake and asked people not to believe in such rumours. Senior officials visited the sites mentioned in the fake messages, conducted a probe in the areas and found all these news to be fake, DCP Prashant Kadam said.

361.title: BJP is well-oiled machinery in Gujarat: AAP's Raghav Chadha
361.article_body: AAP leader Raghav Chadha, who has been appointed co-incharge of the party's Gujarat unit, said that BJP in Gujarat is a well-oiled machinery with unlimited muscle, media and money power. "All media outlets have been given directions to blackout AAP...We understand that with BJP, no election is a level playing field, but this is at a different level," he added.

362.title: FIR against Pune man for posing as Maha CM in photo with gangster Mohol
362.article_body: A man from Pune's Ambegaon was booked for allegedly posing as Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde in a photograph with gangster Sharad Mohol, police said. This comes after a sub-inspector of the crime branch filed a complaint against the accused at the Bundgarden Police Station, police added. The photograph with Mohol maligned Shinde's image, police further said.

363.title: ICC releases list of new rules to be introduced in international cricket from October 1
363.article_body: The ICC released list of new rules that will be introduced in international cricket from October 1. Among the new rules, an incoming batter will be required to be ready to take strike within two minutes in Tests and ODIs. New batters will face next delivery after player is out caught even if batters have crossed before catch is taken.

364.title: First images of Mars captured by the world's most powerful telescope released
364.article_body: The NASA has shared first images of Mars captured by James Webb Space Telescope, the world's most powerful space telescope. A close-up photo of Mars reveals surface features such as Huygens Crater, dark volcanic Syrtis Major, and Hellas Basin. A 'heat map' showing the light being given off by Mars as it loses heat was also captured by the telescope.

365.title: Zomato delivery agent molests woman on pretext of asking for water in Pune
365.article_body: A Zomato food delivery agent was arrested for allegedly molesting a woman in Pune. The 19-year-old woman alleged that the 40-year-old delivery executive asked for water upon delivering her food. When she gave him water, he pulled her close and allegedly kissed her on her cheeks, she told the police.

366.title: Does Virat Kohli's ton as opener create more of a problem?: Ponting
366.article_body: Discussing Virat Kohli's 71st international hundred, which he scored recently as an opener, Ricky Ponting said, "Does that create more of a problem than we thought?" "What are we going to do...going into...T20 World Cup 2022?" added Ponting. Reacting to people stating that Kohli should open in T20 World Cup 2022, Gautam Gambhir recently said, "Don't start this nonsense."

367.title: Shashi Tharoor, Ashok Gehlot likely contenders for Cong chief: Report
367.article_body: Congress leaders Shashi Tharoor and Ashok Gehlot have emerged as the likely contenders for the post of the party's president, as per media reports. Tharoor has reportedly got the nod to contest from interim Congress chief Sonia Gandhi. Gehlot is a supporter of the Gandhi family and has reportedly been trying to persuade Rahul Gandhi to run for the post.

368.title: Scientists create world's first cloned wild Arctic wolf; pics go viral
368.article_body: A wild Arctic wolf was successfully cloned for the first time in the world by scientists at a Beijing-based gene firm. "After two years of painstaking efforts, the Arctic wolf was cloned successfully," Global Times quoted Beijing-based Sinogene Biotechnology Co's general manager Mi Jidong as saying. The wolf named Maya is in good health, according to the company.

369.title: Fortuner car hits multiple vehicles, drags man for 100 metres in Delhi; video surfaces
369.article_body: A Toyota Fortuner car crashed into several parked vehicles and hit a 19-year-old man on a two-wheeler, dragging him for around 100 metres in Delhi's Karol Bagh on Monday evening. The incident was caught on a CCTV camera. Police said the Fortuner's driver was caught and they have sent him for a medical examination to ascertain if he was drunk.

370.title: They wouldn't have sat me back there: Trump on Biden's pic at Queen's funeral
370.article_body: Commenting on a pic showing US President Joe Biden placed 14 rows behind King Charles III at Queen's funeral, Donald Trump wrote, "If I were president, they wouldn't have sat me back there – and our country would be much different than it's right now!" "This is what's happened to America in just two short years. No respect!" he added.

371.title: Sonia gives nod to Tharoor to contest Congress President polls: Reports
371.article_body: According to reports, Congress interim chief Sonia Gandhi has given the nod to MP Shashi Tharoor to contest for the party's President post. "Shashi Tharoor reached out to Sonia Gandhi in a meeting...and said that he can make internal democracy stronger. Sonia replied that he (Shashi Tharoor) can contest if he wants. Anybody can contest elections," said the sources.

372.title: Himachal Congress passes resolution authorising Sonia to choose party chief
372.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Congress passed a resolution authorising interim President Sonia Gandhi to choose the next National President of the party. The resolution also enables Sonia to nominate the new state Congress chief and AICC members. "We passed the resolution in the presence of all the delegates...and everyone extended their support for this," state Congress chief Pratibha Singh said.

373.title: Non-BJP front not possible without Congress' inclusion: Sharad Pawar
373.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Monday said a non-BJP front will only be possible with the inclusion of the Congress party. Pawar further stated that he has met Opposition leaders, including Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, who expressed their views on forming a non-BJP front. But, no planning has been done yet, he added.

374.title: AAP begins 'selfie with kooda' campaign on landfills issue before MCD polls
374.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party has started 'selfie with kooda' campaign to highlight the issue of waste and landfills. The party has also started another campaign named 'BJP ka chamatkaar dekho, koode ka pahad dekho'. Senior AAP leader Dilip Pandey said, "Our slogan is kooda, kachra aur corruption, inme BJP hai number one."

375.title: 1.8 tons of cocaine worth $278 million seized in Nigeria
375.article_body: Authorities in Nigeria have seized 1.8 tons of cocaine which has an estimated street value of $278 million. According to the National Drug Law Enforcement Agency, the cocaine, recovered from a warehouse in Lagos, was to be sold to customers in Europe and Asia. At least four people believed to be members of an international drug syndicate have been arrested.

376.title: Man hiding 1 kg gold in stomach caught at Kerala's Karipur airport
376.article_body: A 36-year-old man was arrested after allegedly getting caught carrying 1.063 kg gold in his stomach at the Karipur airport in Kerala on Monday. He tried to hide the gold inside four capsules. After the police could not find the gold on his body, an X-ray was conducted, which revealed the four capsules containing gold inside his stomach.

377.title: Boundary wall collapses in Noida's Jalvayu Vihar society, 4 dead
377.article_body: At least four persons were killed as a boundary wall in Jalvayu Vihar society in Noida's Sector 21 collapsed on Tuesday morning. "Noida Authority had given a contract for drainage repair work...We've been told when labourers were pulling out bricks, the wall collapsed," Noida DM Suhas LY said. "Police and Fire Department teams are present at the spot," he added.

378.title: Experience 'Mobile Dhamaka' this Amazon Great Indian Festival: Amazon
378.article_body: With the Amazon Great Indian Festival around the corner, Amazon has hinted towards a 'Mobile Dhamaka', with 5G smartphones starting at just ₹11,999. Amazon is also offering Amazon Pay rewards worth ₹1,500 and a free screen replacement, with total additional benefits up to ₹2,300, it said. The festival will be live from September 23.

379.title: Two policemen booked in Maha over impersonation in LLB written exam
379.article_body: A sub-divisional police officer and a constable have been booked in Maharashtra's Jalna over alleged impersonation in a written exam for LLB. The constable appeared in place of the SDPO for the exam held at Bhakt College in February 2020 while the latter was reportedly on official duty. A probe began after an activist submitted a complaint against the two.

380.title: Russia claims Ottawa embassy was attacked; summons Canadian envoy
380.article_body: Russia's Foreign Ministry on Monday summoned the Canadian ambassador and issued a protest over attacks on the Russian embassy in Ottawa. The ministry claimed that an unknown person threw a Molotov cocktail onto the grounds of the Russian embassy in Ottawa on September 12. It also said "aggressive" protestors had blocked an entrance to the consular section of the embassy.

381.title: 'Laal Singh...' was not a wow film: Aamir's brother Faisal Khan
381.article_body: Aamir Khan's brother Faisal Khan said 'Laal Singh Chaddha' was not a "wow film". He said he liked the film "in parts, but not completely". "With Aamir and other good actors, you expect them to do too good work. They should blow your mind. But that didn't happen with 'Laal Singh Chaddha', unfortunately," he added.

382.title: We will not allow ideology of BJP, RSS to divide our country: Rahul Gandhi
382.article_body: Rahul Gandhi said that the BJP spreads hatred and violence, adding that we will not allow the ideology of RSS to divide our country. He was addressing Congress workers on Monday as part of the party's Bharat Jodo Yatra in Kerala's Cherthala. "Do you think a divided society can build hospitals, roads and can educate our children?" he added.

383.title: SpaceX test-fires record 7 engines on Super Heavy Booster 7; video surfaces
383.article_body: SpaceX test-fired seven engines on Starship Super Heavy prototype 'Booster 7', marking the highest number of its new Raptor engines ever tested at the same time. Commenting on a video of the test, CEO Elon Musk said the chamber pressures on all the seven engines "looked good". He added SpaceX will fire all 33 engines in a few weeks.

384.title: 3 men thrashed for objecting to public drinking in Gurugram
384.article_body: Three men were allegedly assaulted in Gurugram's Sector 38 after they objected to two men drinking on their car's bonnet, the police said. The police further informed that they received a call from one of the injured persons who said that a group of around 15 men was assaulting him and his friends outside a liquor shop.

385.title: Richa Chadha to wear her family’s heirloom pieces for wedding: Report
385.article_body: Actress Richa Chadha is reportedly wearing her family's heirloom pieces for her wedding, which is said to be taking place on October 6. The actress is also getting some hand-me-down pieces from her grandmother to be reworked for her D-Day. As per a report, Richa's wedding jewellery is inspired by the royal aesthetics of Rajasthan.

386.title: Putting lots of lights, extra sparkle; looking forward to it: Gauri on Diwali
386.article_body: While talking about Diwali 2022, Gauri Khan said that she is looking forward to it this year. "Well, we haven't started yet but yes, decorating the house and putting loads of lights and an extra sparkle," she said, adding, "I think, in festivals, you look forward to just the family being together and celebrating something and looking forward to something."

387.title: Need to feel proud of our history, we can't be China, Russia or USA: RSS chief
387.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said India needs to retain its essence and identity by embracing its scriptures and ancient history. "There's a need to read and feel proud of our scriptures and history...create a narrative based on them. We cannot be China, Russia or USA. We cannot call it progress, rather we would become a laughing stock," Bhagwat added.

388.title: Odisha's Nandankanan zoo planning to bring 2 cheetahs from Dubai
388.article_body: The authorities at the Nandankanan Zoological Park in Odisha's Bhubaneswar are planning to bring two cheetahs from Dubai. They will be brought as part of an animal exchange programme between the zoo and the Dubai Safari Park. The authorities are also planning to bring five African white lions and chimpanzees in exchange for Manipur brow-antlered deer, hippopotamuses and blackbucks.

389.title: Malaika-Amrita's show 'Arora Sisters' to feature Arbaaz & Arjun: Report
389.article_body: Malaika Arora and Amrita Arora's upcoming show 'Arora Sisters' will reportedly feature Arjun Kapoor and Arbaaz Khan. As per a report, Arjun and Arbaaz will feature in different episodes of the show, which is said to be a peek into the personal and professional lives of Arora siblings. While Malaika is currently dating Arjun Kapoor, she divorced Arbaaz in 2017.

390.title: New back pain test helped 10,000+ people avoid spine surgery: QI Spine
390.article_body: QI Spine shared that a team of spine specialists has found a breakthrough in the treatment of back pain without surgery called Digital Spine Analysis (DSA) to accurately identify the weak areas in the back & neck. QI Spine combines the experience of 300+ doctors, backed by data intelligence aiming to offer the most accurate diagnosis.

391.title: What are you, Karan: Kangana on reports of Brahmastra beating 'The Kashmir...'
391.article_body: While sharing filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri's tweet about 'Brahmastra' beating 'The Kashmir Files' at the box office, actress Kangana Ranaut asked, "What are you Karan Johar ji". "The audacity to belittle The Kashmir Files, a film made on Hindu genocide (and) also trying to ride on its success," she wrote on her Instagram Stories.

392.title: News of me being injured in stone pelting incident in Kashmir is inaccurate: Emraan
392.article_body: Following reports of stone pelting at a film crew in Kashmir, Emraan Hashmi said, "The news of me being injured in a stone pelting incident is inaccurate." Emraan is currently shooting for Marathi filmmaker Tejas Vijay Deoskar's Ground Zero in Kashmir. However, Emraan neither confirmed nor denied whether the incident happened with his film crew.

393.title: Spider spotted on Queen Elizabeth's coffin during her funeral, video goes viral
393.article_body: A video of a spider crawling on top of Queen Elizabeth II's coffin during her funeral service on Monday went viral online. The spider was spotted on the handwritten note, penned by King Charles III for the Queen, placed upon the coffin. "Most famous spider in world right now," a user said, while another wrote, "God save the Royal Spider."

394.title: Queen's horse Emma bids farewell to late monarch at Windsor Castle, pic surfaces
394.article_body: Queen Elizabeth II's horse, Carltonlima Emma, bid farewell to the late monarch as her coffin processed through Windsor Castle on Monday. The horse was accompanied by Terry Pendry, the Queen’s head groom, who has held the position for the past 25 years. The Stud Groom bowed his head as the State Hearse passed by, while Emma stood by his side.

395.title: Police team attacked, constable's uniform torn in Gurugram; 1 arrested
395.article_body: A man from Gurugram's Palra village was arrested for attacking police and tearing a constable's uniform for asking him to stop creating ruckus. The incident occurred on Sunday when police went to the accused's house responding to a call of a domestic row. According to Head Constable Amir Singh, the accused also threatened to kill the officers before being arrested.

396.title: K'taka hijab ban part of pattern to marginalise minorities: Petitioner to SC
396.article_body: Petitioners who challenged the hijab ban in Karnataka educational institutes told the Supreme Court that the ban shows "a pattern to marginalise the minority community". The petitioner further stated that hijab is part of their identity, asking if wearing it threatens the unity or integrity of the country. "That nobody is saying...Even the [High Court] judgment doesn't say," SC stated.

397.title: Adani Group to double cement making capacity to 140 mn tonnes in 5 yrs
397.article_body: Adani Group is planning to double its cement manufacturing capacity to 140 million tonnes in next five years. Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani said he saw a multifold rise in cement demand in India. Last week, Adani Group completed its $6.5 billion acquisition of Ambuja Cements and ACC. Adani Group has cement production capacity of 70 million tonnes per annum.

398.title: Central investigation agencies can open offices at my home: Bihar Dy CM
398.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav said that central investigation agencies including CBI, Enforcement Directorate and Income Tax are free to open their offices at his home. This comes two days after the CBI moved a Delhi court seeking the cancellation of bail granted to Tejashwi in the IRCTC scam. "BJP is scared of the 2024 Lok Sabha elections," he added.

399.title: US engineer freed by Taliban in exchange for Afghan drug trafficker
399.article_body: The Taliban on Monday released a US engineer in exchange for an Afghan tribal leader detained by the US in 2005 over drug charges. The US Navy veteran Mark Frerichs, who was taken hostage in 2020, was exchanged at Kabul airport for Bashir Noorzai. US President Joe Biden said that the swap required "difficult decisions" that he didn't take lightly.

400.title: 56-year-old man moves Delhi HC to ensure family doesn't perform last rites
400.article_body: A 56-year-old man with cardiac ailments approached Delhi High Court to prevent his wife, daughter or son-in-law from performing his last rites. He claimed his family treated him with cruelty and he wasn't even invited to his daughter's wedding. He wants his body to be handed over to a man who took care of him and is "like his son".
